  • Method Details

    • assertEquals

      public static void assertEquals​(java.lang.Object expectedValue, java.lang.Object actualValue, int assertionComparisonType, java.lang.Boolean assertionType)
      Asserts that two objects are equal if AssertionType is true, or not equal if AssertionType is false.

      This method will be removed soon. Use assertEquals(Object , Object , AssertionComparisonType , AssertionType) instead.

      Parameters:
      expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this assertion
      actualValue - the actual value (calculated data) of this assertion
      assertionComparisonType - 1 is literalComparison, 2 is regexComparison, 3 is containsComparison, 4 is caseInsensitiveComparison
      assertionType - either 'true' for a positive assertion that the objects are equal, or 'false' for a negative assertion that the objects are not equal

    • assertEquals

      public static void assertEquals​(java.lang.Object expectedValue, java.lang.Object actualValue, Assertions.AssertionComparisonType assertionComparisonType, Assertions.AssertionType assertionType)
      Asserts that two objects are equal if AssertionType is POSITIVE, or not equal if AssertionType is NEGATIVE.
      Parameters:
      expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this assertion
      actualValue - the actual value (calculated data) of this assertion
      assertionComparisonType - AssertionComparisonType.LITERAL, CONTAINS, REGEX, CASE_INSENSITIVE
      assertionType - AssertionType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE

    • assertNull

      public static void assertNull​(java.lang.Object object, java.lang.Boolean assertionType)
      Asserts that object is null if AssertionType is true, or is not null if AssertionType is false.

      This method will be removed soon. Use assertNull(Object , AssertionType) instead.

      Parameters:
      object - the object under test
      assertionType - either 'true' for a positive assertion that the object refers to null, or 'false' for a negative assertion that the object doesn't refer to null

    • assertNull

      public static void assertNull​(java.lang.Object object, Assertions.AssertionType assertionType)
      Asserts that object is null if AssertionType is POSITIVE, or is not null if AssertionType is NEGATIVE.
      Parameters:
      object - the object under test
      assertionType - AssertionType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE

    • assertElementExists

      public static void assertElementExists​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, java.lang.Boolean assertionType)
      Asserts that webElement found using the provided driver and locator exists if AssertionType is true, or does not exist if AssertionType is false.

      This method will be removed soon. Use assertElementExists(WebDriver, By, AssertionType) instead.

      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      assertionType - either 'true' for a positive assertion that the element exists, or 'false' for a negative assertion that the element doesn't exist

    • assertElementExists

      public static void assertElementExists​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, Assertions.AssertionType assertionType)
      Asserts that webElement found using the provided driver and locator exists if AssertionType is POSITIVE, or does not exist if AssertionType is NEGATIVE.
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      assertionType - AssertionType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE

    • assertElementAttribute

      public static void assertElementAttribute​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, java.lang.String elementAttribute, java.lang.String expectedValue, int assertionComparisonType, java.lang.Boolean assertionType)
      Asserts webElement attribute equals expectedValue if AssertionType is true, or does not equal expectedValue if AssertionType is false. Supports Text, TagName, Size, Other Attributes

      This method will be removed soon. Use assertElementAttribute(WebDriver , By , String , String , AssertionComparisonType , AssertionType) instead.

      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      elementAttribute - the desired attribute of the webElement under test
      expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this assertion
      assertionComparisonType - 1 is literalComparison, 2 is regexComparison, 3 is containsComparison, 4 is caseInsensitiveComparison
      assertionType - either 'true' for a positive assertion that the element attribute actual value matches the expected value, or 'false' for a negative assertion that the element attribute actual value doesn't match the expected value

    • assertElementAttribute

      public static void assertElementAttribute​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, java.lang.String elementAttribute, java.lang.String expectedValue, Assertions.AssertionComparisonType assertionComparisonType, Assertions.AssertionType assertionType)
      Asserts webElement attribute equals expectedValue if AssertionType is POSITIVE, or does not equal expectedValue if AssertionType is NEGATIVE. Supports Text, TagName, Size, Other Attributes
      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      elementAttribute - the desired attribute of the webElement under test
      expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this assertion
      assertionComparisonType - AssertionComparisonType.LITERAL, CONTAINS, REGEX, CASE_INSENSITIVE
      assertionType - AssertionType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE

    • assertElementCSSProperty

      public static void assertElementCSSProperty​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator, java.lang.String propertyName, java.lang.String expectedValue, int assertionComparisonType, java.lang.Boolean assertionType)
      Asserts webElement CSSProperty equals expectedValue if AssertionType is true, or does not equal expectedValue if AssertionType is false.

      This method will be removed soon. Use assertElementCSSProperty(WebDriver, By, String, String, AssertionComparisonType, AssertionType) instead.

      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
      propertyName - the target CSS property of the webElement under test
      expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this assertion
      assertionComparisonType - 1 is literalComparison, 2 is regexComparison, 3 is containsComparison, 4 is caseInsensitiveComparison
      assertionType - either 'true' for a positive assertion that the element CSSProperty actual value matches the expected value, or 'false' for a negative assertion that the element CSSProperty actual value doesn't match the expected value

    • assertBrowserAttribute

      public static void assertBrowserAttribute​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, java.lang.String browserAttribute, java.lang.String expectedValue, int assertionComparisonType, java.lang.Boolean assertionType)
      Asserts browser attribute equals expectedValue if AssertionType is true, or does not equal expectedValue if AssertionType is false. Supports CurrentUrl, PageSource, Title, WindowHandle, WindowPosition, WindowSize

      This method will be removed soon. Use assertBrowserAttribute(WebDriver , String , String , AssertionComparisonType , AssertionType ) instead.

      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      browserAttribute - the desired attribute of the browser window under test
      expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this assertion
      assertionComparisonType - 1 is literalComparison, 2 is regexComparison, 3 is containsComparison, 4 is caseInsensitiveComparison
      assertionType - either 'true' for a positive assertion that the browser attribute actual value matches the expected value, or 'false' for a negative assertion that the browser attribute actual value doesn't match the expected value

    • assertBrowserAttribute

      public static void assertBrowserAttribute​(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, java.lang.String browserAttribute, java.lang.String expectedValue, Assertions.AssertionComparisonType assertionComparisonType, Assertions.AssertionType assertionType)
      Asserts browser attribute equals expectedValue if AssertionType is POSITIVE, or does not equal expectedValue if AssertionType is NEGATIVE. Supports CurrentUrl, PageSource, Title, WindowHandle, WindowPosition, WindowSize *

      This method will be removed soon. Use assertBrowserAttribute(WebDriver , String , String , AssertionComparisonType , AssertionType ) instead.

      Parameters:
      driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
      browserAttribute - the desired attribute of the browser window under test
      expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this assertion
      assertionComparisonType - AssertionComparisonType.LITERAL, CONTAINS, REGEX, CASE_INSENSITIVE
      assertionType - AssertionType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE

    • assertComparativeRelation

      public static void assertComparativeRelation​(java.lang.Number expectedValue, java.lang.Number actualValue, java.lang.String comparativeRelationType, java.lang.Boolean assertionType)
      Asserts that the expectedValue is related to the actualValue using the desired comparativeRelationType if AssertionType is true, or not related if AssertionType is false.

      This method will be removed soon. Use assertComparativeRelation(Number, Number, ComparativeRelationType, AssertionType) instead.

      Parameters:
      expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this assertion
      actualValue - the actual value (calculated data) of this assertion
      comparativeRelationType - accepts standard java Equality, Relational, and Conditional Operators, except [not equal to]: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/op2.html
      assertionType - either 'true' for a positive assertion that the expectedValue is related to the actualValue using the desired comparativeRelationType, or 'false' for a negative assertion that the expectedValue is not related to the actualValue using the desired comparativeRelationType

    • assertComparativeRelation

      public static void assertComparativeRelation​(java.lang.Number expectedValue, java.lang.Number actualValue, Assertions.ComparativeRelationType comparativeRelationType, Assertions.AssertionType assertionType)
      Asserts that the expectedValue is related to the actualValue using the desired comparativeRelationType if AssertionType is POSITIVE, or not related if AssertionType is NEGATIVE.
      Parameters:
      expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this assertion
      actualValue - the actual value (calculated data) of this assertion
      comparativeRelationType - assertComparativeRelation.GREATER_THAN, GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUALS, LESS_THAN, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUALS, EQUALS
      assertionType - AssertionType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE

    • assertFileExists

      public static void assertFileExists​(java.lang.String fileFolderName, java.lang.String fileName, int numberOfRetries, java.lang.Boolean assertionType)
      Asserts that a certain file exists if AssertionType is true, or doesn't exist if AssertionType is false.

      This method will be removed soon. Use assertFileExists(String , String , int , AssertionType ) instead.

      Parameters:
      fileFolderName - The location of the folder that contains the target file, relative to the project's root folder, ending with a /
      fileName - The name of the target file (including its extension if any)
      numberOfRetries - number of times to try to find the file, given that each retry is separated by a 500 millisecond wait time
      assertionType - either 'true' for a positive assertion that the file exists, or 'false' for a negative assertion that the file doesn't exist

    • assertFileExists

      public static void assertFileExists​(java.lang.String fileFolderName, java.lang.String fileName, int numberOfRetries, Assertions.AssertionType assertionType)
      Asserts that a certain file exists if AssertionType is POSITIVE, or doesn't exist if AssertionType is NEGATIVE.
      Parameters:
      fileFolderName - The location of the folder that contains the target file, relative to the project's root folder, ending with a /
      fileName - The name of the target file (including its extension if any)
      numberOfRetries - number of times to try to find the file, given that each retry is separated by a 500 millisecond wait time
      assertionType - AssertionType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE

    • assertTrue

      public static void assertTrue​(java.lang.Boolean conditionalStatement, Assertions.AssertionType assertionType)
      Asserts that the provided conditional statement evaluates to true if AssertionType is POSITIVE, or to false if AssertionType is NEGATIVE.
      Parameters:
      conditionalStatement - the statement that will be evaluated to see if it matches the expected result
      assertionType - AssertionType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE

    • assertJSONFileContent

      public static void assertJSONFileContent​(io.restassured.response.Response response, java.lang.String referenceJsonFilePath, RestActions.ComparisonType comparisonType, Assertions.AssertionType assertionType)
      Asserts that the target API Response object matches the expected referenceJsonFile if AssertionType is POSITIVE, or doesn't match it if AssertionType is NEGATIVE.
      Parameters:
      response - the full response object returned by performRequest method.
      referenceJsonFilePath - the full absolute path to the test data file that will be used as a reference for this comparison
      comparisonType - ComparisonType.EQUALS, CONTAINS, MATCHES, EQUALS_STRICT; Note that MATCHES ignores the content ordering inside the JSON
      assertionType - AssertionType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE

    • assertJSONFileContent

      public static void assertJSONFileContent​(io.restassured.response.Response response, java.lang.String referenceJsonFilePath, RestActions.ComparisonType comparisonType, java.lang.String jsonPathToTargetArray, Assertions.AssertionType assertionType)
      Asserts that the target array extracted by parsing the API Response object matches the expected referenceJsonFile if AssertionType is POSITIVE, or doesn't match it if AssertionType is NEGATIVE.
      Parameters:
      response - the full response object returned by performRequest method.
      referenceJsonFilePath - the full absolute path to the test data file that will be used as a reference for this comparison
      comparisonType - ComparisonType.EQUALS, CONTAINS, MATCHES, EQUALS_STRICT; Note that MATCHES ignores the content ordering inside the JSON
      jsonPathToTargetArray - a jsonpath that will be parsed to point to the target JSON Array
      assertionType - AssertionType.POSITIVE, NEGATIVE
